intro: Coreopsis nuecensoides, commonly known as the Mexican coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, bright yellow to orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and grasslands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Coreopsis nuecensoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
